page.title: 13TRANSPORT
page.content: Through the area two important roads provide access to the M.50; B4216 Highnam-Newent and A.417 Gloucester -Ledbury. It is proposed to reclassify the B4216 to become an 'A' road - main route to the motorway. From a traffic count outside Hartpury School we found that 380 vehicles per hour pass; the rate increases on Gloucester Market Days. The Survey also showed that 77% of villagers wanted the speed limit lowered to 30 m.p.h., because of the two dangerous bends in the centre of the village. Whilst the majority of families have a car, we found that 15% of those surveyed still used public transport. There are 3 bus services ; Swanbrook Transport for Hartpury; the National Welsh Omnibus along B.4216; and Bennett Coaches to Highleadon.
